result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonah S Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in full by 07-15-2016 or serve 3 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonah S Mueller

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonah S Mueller in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  

State moves to amend count 2 to a county ordinance.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $236
To be paid in full by:  07/15/16
Alternate:  3 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonah S Mueller in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant currently engaged in treatment.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing at 02-11-2016 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-16-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonah S Mueller in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

No contact is to be modified to No Violent Contact and only with the victim's permission.

Defendant Jonah S Mueller in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis. 

Defense wants to address Modification of Bail Conditions.
